column5: Glad you guys had a good day out it was nice to see you two Paul I have to agree you are good for laughs.DOH!!!!!  Peter
Roy maybe Im thick I dont get Red
Forget it I just thinned out and looked at my profile picture yeah maybe a paint job this winter into a CANADIAN FLAG
Fantastic day on the water!! Congrats on the PB Joey!! What a brute!
Great report.......love to see these guys when they arent all green'ed up
nice day on the water congrats on your pb
Nice fish there Joey and Paul!!!
Hahahaha, good one Connie.  Thanks again all, we had a really great day.  Now to start packing for Lakair and the other monster fish
In no way am I going to laugh at Paul. I have pulled the boat up and forgot to trim the motor up when leaving the ramp,,,while the boat was on the trailer.  Nice fish J. Congrats.
Joey, great report!! Nice fish!! Good  to see you two are sliming up that shiny Lund REAL GOOD!!!!!
WTG Joey....what a piggy salmon....fantastic  I dont think that fish should be allowed in the competition as it clearly states in the regs that the date on the card has to be in RED....  :rofl2:
Great report and congrats on your PB
Gorgeous looking fish! Must have been anadventure trying to grab them.
Congrats Joey.   Good to see you were able to land that one with no net.  But, I'll bet there's a wee bit bigger one out there with your name on it.   Just getting warmed up now.

Headed out to the big lake this morning and it was like a comedy of errors I'll tell ya.  We got launched no problem and headed out and then stopped the boat at the area we wanted to start fishing, about 150 FOW, to set up.  As soon as Paul turned the engine off we could hear the trim going.  The engine was stuck in the trim down position.  After unhooking it from the battery and taking the engine cover off and cursing, Paul finally had an AHA moment and went up on the deck and lifted the rain suit bag off the trim switch  Sooooo, as I drove Paul set up two lines to start, sat down and said "Oh crap, I forgot the net."  Oh well, we were there, lets fish dangit!!!  Right off the get go we had a line peeler.  I was first up and after some fun times trying to hand bomb it into the boat, we had our first fish landed      Had a few moments to breath and relax before the next fish!      We kept passing by these huge bait balls and they were so thick the lines would shake and vibrate the whole time as they passed through and dinged off the bait.       We missed two hits, or they just did not commit, and then paul had a good fish on.  Of course I had to take his rod at the end so he could hand bomb this one too     Back to my turn again and this one screamed off line, did several acrobatics and then headed to the bottom, peeling off about 200 feet of line.  It was a long and heavy fight to get her in.  I figured no way was this one gonna be easy to get hand bombed and into the boat, but Paul managed to do it.  My PB Salmon     39 inches, a few quick pics and back into the drink she went.  No time to weigh, I wanted her to live.          We headed back in as the bite seemed to turn off and found this biker on shore!!  Great to see you again Peter and nice bike        Found this hijacker in the livewell.  Now it is hopefully some turkey vulture or hawk's next meal.       Couple of young goslings losing their down.       Great day on the water, a bit windy and lots of whitecaps for awhile, but had a good time.  Cheers,  Joey
real nice looking fish there
Nice to see the duo out and about!!! It wouldn't be a fishing trip with Paul without some comedy.....
Great report Joey!!  Sounds like quite the adventure, with the problems to begin with, but, all played out well with some beauty fish!  Congrats on the new PB!
Truer words....  Congrats on the PB Joey, good fish anytime, especially with no net.  Oh and whats with the white in the goatee Paul, copycat....LMAO
Nice fish guys, looks like a great day!
Great report and pics Joey That PB of yours, is a real beaut    Congrats Even without the net.... aren't you glad you stuck with plan A  Thanks for sharing Jacques
Nice going guys congrats for the hand landing lets see that this fall

Fantastic, guys! Really happy for you! No net is easy, I wanna see you try it with a net and no rods. Really glad you had a good day, weather looked iffy there for a while. Quite the boost for team #5 too!  Oh wait, Paul didn't forget the sign too did he? Beauty pics Dearheart.  Pete, I always figured you for a red bike.
Great report and pics!  Congrats on that new PB!  Amazing job without a net!  Sure looked like a beauty day out there
Thanks all, and Roy, it definately is a boost for Team 5
Looks like a great day on the water with some nice fish...thats a real respectable Salmon! Good thing the motor in the trim didn't burn out as well  Cheers,
Nice fish Joey!
Hi Joey and Paul,  Congrats on the PB and also on a great days fishing.  Colin.
looks like an awesome day out despite the setbacks and congrats on your PB!!  -AA
WTG Joey. Congrats on the pb. Must have been a fun day after all the crap that happened. Nice sharp photos too!!
Excellent.  I can't wait to get out there. Solid fish.
nice fish .. .congrats on the PB
Hey Great report. Those are some real nice salmon. Great pics.
Good job Joey!!  Lake O is starting to heat up!
Yowza !!!!!!!!!! You guys had an amazing day Thats some nice fish you landed Joey ! Gonna be hard to beat it Thanks for sharing your day. awesome job.  Paul
Fun stuff Joey & congrats on the PB !!
Nice trip glad to see a PB too.   Art
Nice going.  Way to spend a day on the water.  You've joined the Wallendas.  They never use a net.
Sharp as ever, Connie.
